required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Use of IMSI in Poor Responders to IVF
clinical_study.official_title: Use of Intra-Cytoplasmic Morphologically Selected Sperm Injection (IMSI) in Poor Responders to In Vitro Fertilization (IVF): a Prospective, Double-blind, Randomized, Controlled Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Centro de Infertilidad y Reproducción Humana

clinical_study.source: Centro de Infertilidad y Reproducción Humana

brief_summary.textblock: This is a pilot study which aims to determine the role of IMSI in poor responders.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a pilot study which aims to determine the role of IMSI over ICSI in poor responders to IVF, without a background of teratozoospermia.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Four to six weeks after embryo transfer
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients presenting with presence of an intrauterine gestational sac with embryonic cardiac activity display, evaluated by ultrasound, per cycle initiated

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of cycles with embryo transfer
secondary_outcome.description: Number of cycles reaching embryo transfer per cycle initiated

intervention.description: Selection of sperm at 400x for sperm injection
Selection of sperm at 6000x for sperm injection

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- poor ovarian response
Exclusion Criteria:
- body mass index (BMI) ≥ 30 kg/m2
- presence of endocrinopathies (e.g., diabetes, hyperprolactinemia, hypothyroidism)
- altered karyotype or documented genetic defects in one or both partners
- history of chronic, autoimmune or metabolic diseases
- altered meiosis in testicular biopsy or altered sperm-FISH
- teratozoospermia
- participation, simultaneously or within the previous 6 months, in another clinical trial with medication

overall_official.affiliation: Centro de Infertilidad y Reproducción Humana (CIRH)

facility.name: Centro de Infertilidad y Reproducción Humana (CIRH)
